answers.author: Leslie Beauregard
answers.text:
Pamela;  This hasn't been as much of a big deal the past few years, but Charlottesville used to make United Way  Day of Caring a real employee event.  We would create teams of employees and the Department Heads would do a special project.  It was a lot of fun and while it's been more "organic" the past few years, it's still a great morale booster for those of us who do it.  I especially enjoy getting to know employees I have never met...now that Department Heads don't do their own project we just join the teams.

answers.author: Vickie Atkinson
answers.text:
We have had much success in the City of Durham with our Culture of Service program. One of the 3 points of service is Service to Community. A major focus for the past 3 years has been Habitat for Humanity. We support Habitat with tee-shirt sales/donations, volunteer builds and designation through our community giving (7 Stars) campaign. We also volunteer with the public schools and nonprofits and participate in community events/walks. 7 Stars holds numerous fun events throughout the year to raise money for local non-profits. Events include a Dunking Booth, Chilli Challenge, fish fry, tricycle race, book sale, pig picking, dessert bar, hot dog sales, gift wrapping station, etc. - sponsored by various departments and attended by all! Our recent employee opinion survey validated our Culture of Service contributions to satisfaction.
